1.rationale:
Let’s break down the situation after our last move. Our snake (#1) has just moved from (3,3) to (3,4), where we consumed the apple that was “directly above” our former position. (That apple is now gone, and our snake has grown.) The board now shows our head at (3,4) and our body’s tail (“T”) at (3,3).

The remaining apples are at:
• (8,4) – to our right on the same row
• (1,3) – down and to the left
• (0,2) – further down/left
• (3,6) – two steps directly above our head
• (6,0) – down/right

The enemy snake (#2) is at (5,9), which is far away from us.

Now we evaluate our move options from our current head position at (3,4):

• UP → This moves us to (3,5). Checking the board, row 5 appears empty. More importantly, moving up places us on a direct path toward the apple at (3,6) (which is just one move further after (3,5)). This is both safe and sets up for an easy gain in points.

• RIGHT → This would take us to (4,4). That’s safe, and it moves us toward the apple at (8,4), but it’s a longer run compared to the apple just above us.

• LEFT → Moving to (2,4) is also safe, but it’s not particularly directed toward any apple.
 
• DOWN → That would move us back into (3,3) where our tail “T” is. Although in many Snake games the tail vacates unless we just ate an apple (and indeed we did just eat one, so we grow and our tail would stay for an extra turn), it’s riskier to move into a space that currently contains our body.

Given these considerations, the best move is to continue with UP. It’s safe, it brings us closer to the apple at (3,6), and there are no nearby threats.

Next move: UP

2.rationale:

The snake is currently at position (5, 9), and there are several apples on the board. The closest apple is at (3, 6), so that would be a good target to go for. However, the enemy snake is currently at (3, 4), which is in the path to that apple.

If I move up, I can avoid the enemy snake for now, but I'll be further away from the apple at (3, 6). Moving down or to the left would put me closer to that apple, but it would also bring me closer to the enemy snake, which could be risky.

Ultimately, I think the safest option is to continue moving up. This will keep me out of the enemy snake's immediate vicinity and give me some time to re-evaluate the situation and plan my next move.

My next move will be: UP
